clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Computer-assisted Cognitive Rehabilitation, Placebo and Drug Therapy in the Treatment of ADHD
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Efficacy of Computer-assisted Cognitive Rehabilitation (CACR), Stimulants Drug, and Placebo on Executive Functions and the Clinical Symptoms of Children With Attention Deficit/ Hyperactivity Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: Current research aimed to compare the efficacy of computer-assisted cognitive rehabilitation (CACR), stimulant drugs and placebo on executive functions and clinical symptoms of children with attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

detailed_description.textblock: the investigators administered a randomized controlled trial (RCT) through random assignment of ADHD subjects in to three different groups to compare the effects of CACR, immediate-release methylphenidate, and a Placebo treatment (i.e. some computerized tasks assumed not have any therapeutic effects)on ADHD children's performance.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: changes from baseline in Executive Functions(working memory, inhibition response,planning,sustain attention)and clinical symptoms of attention deficit hyperactive disorder at 5 months
primary_outcome.description: The research design was experimental type and pretest, post-test, and follow-up with two experimental groups. All of participants were assessed about executive functions(working memory, inhibition response,planning,sustain attention)and clinical symptoms of attention deficit hyperactive disorder in duration of before, after interventions (i.e. after 8 weeks), and 3 month after the interventions were stop.

arm_group.description: -Computerized cognitive rehabilitation: 20 one-hour-sessions of computerized cognitive rehabilitation.
-placebo group simultaneously received 20 one-hour-sessions of placebo of computerized training.
-10mg Ritalin tablets per day during tow months.

intervention.description: - Computerized cognitive rehabilitation: 20 one-hour-sessions of computerized cognitive rehabilitation.
-drug therapy: 2 or 3 doses of 10mg tablets of Immediate-release Methylphenidate (Ritalin)per day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ADHD diagnosis
- age between 7 and 12
- IQ > 85
Exclusion Criteria:
- sever co-morbid disorder
- seizure
- IQ < 85
- disability
- sever medical condition
